item.title: Big pothole near drain, 21st October
item.description:

item.title: Large laughing gas canister needs to be disposed of appropriately, 21st October
item.description:
I found a large laughing gas canister in the gutter. I placed it beside the green box in Hawthorne Road. Whilst doing this, I also noticed that someone has put a saw behind this box so please could this be removed too.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hawthorne Road, Bickley, London

item.title: Dead tree needs replacing please!, 21st October
item.description:
The street tree between 25 and 27 Aldermary Road died within a year of planting, despite it being watered by residents and by the contractors. Please may it be removed and replaced with a new tree? Many thanks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Aldermary Road, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street trading without a licence, 21st October
item.description:
We R Blighty street trading in Bromley High Sreet, When asked if they had a street licence, they said they didn't need one as they were a Community Interest Company. They clim to be collecting for honeless veterans but various publicity abouyt them indicates this may not be genuine. Please be aware that they have already pleaded guilty to illegal street trading in the City of London and fined on conviction.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 123 - 131, High Street, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Excessive amount of fallen leaves Maple Crescent, 21st October
item.description:
Please can we have a street cleaning team tasked to clear and remove the excessive amount of fallen tree leaves in Maple Crescent including the Cul de Sac on the pavement and roadway as the rain has now made surfaces slippery. This is likely to affect the effectiveness of rain water running into drains causing possible flooding. Particularly as there is a Met Office Yellow Warning for the week commencing 20.10.25. Thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Maple Crescent, Blackfen, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Leaf sweeping vehicles, 21st October
item.description:
The road sweeping vehicle rushed along Farnaby rd this morning weaving in and out , not stopping to collect leaves from drains or kerb sides , your basically paying for a bloke to just drive around because he certainly wasn’t making any effort to collect leaves .the street drains are covered in leaves ,and it wasn’t because cars were parked and he couldn’t access ..,we watched as he just drove in and out not doing anything ,waste of council tax money .its your trees ,your leaves Bromley clear it up because our green bin is too full of your leaves to fit any more in , ,
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Farnaby Road, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Church Row opposite the bottom of Holly Walk, 21st October
item.description:
The light over the gate from the churchyard onto the road is out. It's really dangerous for people crossing the road there. Although it's in the churchyard it is on the Camden system not the church's.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Church Row, West Hampstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet
